alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 2:43PM CST until December 19 at 7:15PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Jacks Fork River at Eminence affecting Shannon County. For the Jacks Fork River Basin...including Alley Spring, Eminence... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Jacks Fork River at Eminence. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, low lying areas including the Rivers Edge Lodge and canoe rental locations in Eminence flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CST Saturday the stage was 13.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM CST Saturday was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 2.4 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 04/25/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 245 PM CST.
